user_card_view.bio: Husband, dad, founder of HiView Solutions, a leading Google Partner for #googleworkspace. I cast about sales, web3, and tech tools for SMBs

top_casts.text:
I see the root cause of the FTX debacle was running thin fractional reserves. Exchanges need 1/1 reserves, nothing less. 

Aside, banking policy in the US allows this ratio to be at 0%. Can someone explain this for me? https://www.federalreserve.gov/monetarypolicy/reservereq.htm

7) Finance aside, I also also predict a huge amount of applications built atop other blockchains in the coming years, creating tons of value. Metaverse like stuff, NFTs, etc. I believe this will be an entirely net new sector of growth

4) A big thing I‚Äôm starting to watch more closely ‚Äî The path to CBDCs - central bank digital currencies, which i believe will happen in the next decade or two. Governments digitizing control of money will absolutely happen, maybe not in the USA but elsewhere.

2) In my mind, the innovation really accelerated in the past 3 years, with defi, NFTs, daos, and much broader global adoption. Total Unique active crypto wallets with money in them is at or near all time highs for the big blockchains. There‚Äôs such strong network effects!

A friend of mine asked for my take on crypto and what the future holds. Just wanted to share a couple thoughts. üßµ

1) On a macro timeline, we‚Äôre still only a decade or so since Bitcoin was founded, and really 2017/2018 is when we started to see big innovations built atop crypto.

5) Imagine if stimulus checks could be delivered instantly to digital wallets in seconds! Think government programmable money, where they can set the rules and enforce them. China has their digital yuan pilot already and a huge amount of countries are launching CBDCs.

6) One prediction is in another decade, we‚Äôll see a world full of government controlled CBDCs and a few large ‚Äústore of value‚Äù blockchains like ETH and Bitcoin, where people are swapping to and from and between CBDCs.
3) That said, I think there‚Äôs a lot more carnage ahead in the next few months following the whole FTX thing and a high interest rate environment the next few years. But it‚Äôs all short term.

8) Just a net new industry and value creation. If this does happen, ETH and Bitcoin will be two big elements.¬†ETH is now deflationary and the supply of Bitcoin is so limited. I don‚Äôt think you can loose with either over 10 years, and there‚Äôs a chance these absolutely rip. ‚ÄúNFA!‚Äù
